summary: The George Floyd Justice in Policing Act of 2025 aims to reform law enforcement through several key provisions. It addresses police accountability in courts, qualified immunity reform, pattern and practice investigations, and independent investigations of police misconduct. The bill also promotes policing transparency through data collection, a national police misconduct registry, and use-of-force reporting. Furthermore, it seeks to improve police training and policies by focusing on racial profiling, no-knock warrants in drug cases, and body camera usage. Finally, it addresses sexual misconduct by law enforcement. The bill's goal is to increase accountability, transparency, and improve community relations with law enforcement.
